page.title: 09EMPLOYMENT IN FARLEY
page.content: Although there is a lot of farmland around Farley, most people do not work on the farms. Some of the jobs people do are aircraft engineer manager, self-employed spar maker, chef, seller of swimming pools, doctor, carpenter, scrap man, British Telecom engineer, car body builders, Airline pilot, builder, farmer and farm manager. Obviously most of these have to travel to work. The furthest anyone travels is to Heathrow Airport, London and that is the pilot. There are eight farms in Farley, dairy farms, chicken farms and mixed farms. Mr. Parsons has the largest mixed farm with a big Freisan dairy herd. There are two chicken farms which keep the hens in large chicken huts. One sells the eggs mainly and the other sells the hens.
